articleBlock.title: A cleaning hub with built-in ventilation
articleBlock.secondTitle: Use a rod and a shower curtain to create a complement to your cleaning cupboard. Unsightly equipment is stored out of sight yet accessibly close – while the air flow helps dry any dampness.
articleBlock.subTitle: Your bathroom serves a string of busy functions on a daily basis. See how you can make all of them work, and still have room for comfort and relaxation.

blockInfo.title: Storage with a calming effect
blockInfo.secondTitle: Kit your clutter for easy access
blockInfo.subTitle: Having a lot to store doesn’t mean it all has to go in a cupboard. Many bathroom items are better kept out in the open – either to be close at hand or are nice to look at. Add a plant or two to set a calm mood for the entire room (and they’ll thrive in the humid air).
blockInfo.secondSubTitle: Even if you have a cabinet ready to swallow the clutter, it’s worth resisting a little. Let containers hold kits for different activities – home spa, make-up, personal hygiene – to bring out or put back at a moment’s notice.

blockInfo.title: An ecosystem of towels
blockInfo.secondTitle: Make your mop disappear
blockInfo.subTitle: Racks or hooks that allow air to circulate around each towel prolong their freshness. They dry quick and the need for frequent washing is minimized.
blockInfo.secondSubTitle: Having your cleaning tools organized makes them easier to both use and return to. When they’re not needed, close the curtain and feel the peace of mind it brings.
